Courses.title: Course "Introduzione all'Informatica e alle Reti"
Courses.subtitle: University of Turin - Department of Cultures, Politics and Society
Courses.description: The course (42 hours - 6 CFU) is an introduction to Computer Science and Networks. Topics: representation of information in computers, computer architectures, operative systems, networks and security.

Masters & Schools.title: Lecturer at GAIA 2025 Winter School
Masters & Schools.subtitle: University of Bologna - Department of Computer Science
Masters & Schools.description: During the GAIA 2025 Winter School I lectured 2 hours on the topic "What are actually Large Language Models?". The lesson gives an overview of neural networks, embeddings and LLMs, their current applications and limitations.

Masters & Schools.title: Lecturer in Master Etica e intelligenza artificiale (MEIA)
Masters & Schools.subtitle: University of Turin - Department of Philosophy and Education Sciences
Masters & Schools.description: During the MEIA master I lectured 4 hours on the topic "A brief introduction to LLMs". During the lesson I have introduced the basic concepts of neural networks, embeddings and LLMs. Students were tasked with the annotation of hate speech messages in order to compare such annotations with the one made by several LLMs.

Masters & Schools.title: Lecturer in Corso Universitario di Aggiornamento Professionale (CUAP)
Masters & Schools.subtitle: University of Turin - Department of Computer Science
Masters & Schools.description: During the CUAP "Data Steward" I lectured 4 hours on the topic "ChatGPT: usages and risks". During the lesson I have introduced the basic concepts of neural networks and Large Language Models. Students were tasked with the development of a little benchmark for the evaluation of ChatGPT in the scope of narrative stories generation.

Masters & Schools.title: Lecturer for first level Master (MADAS)
Masters & Schools.subtitle: University of Turin - Department of Economics and Statistics
Masters & Schools.description: During the Master in Data Science for Business Intelligence I lectured 8 hours on the topics of knowledge representation, semantic networks, conceptual similarity, word sense disambiguation and keyword extraction. The students were tasked with two different exercises concerning conceptual similarity and keyword extraction.
